Constructor Detail

Board2d

public Board2d()
The constructor to instantiate a 2d sudoku. The constructor also checks whether the sudoku is not conflicting. Exits the program is the sudoku is conflicting. Reads a sudoku from a file to load into the field.

Board2d

public Board2d(int[][] sudoku)
The constructor to instantiate a 2d sudoku. The constructor also checks whether the sudoku is not conflicting. Exits the program is the sudoku is conflicting.

Parameters:
sudoku - The sudoku to work with.
Method Detail

readSudoku

public int[][] readSudoku()
This method reads the sudoku from a file. This method reads just 81 characters on a single line. So that behind the sudoku, it is possible to put some comments about the sudoku being read.

Returns:
The read sudoku.

possibleNumbers

public boolean possibleNumbers(int i,
                               int j,
                               int possibleNum,
                               int[][] sudoku)
Returns whether a certain value can be filled in a cell. This method checks whether it is possible to fill in a cell with a certain value.

Parameters:
i - The row number.
j - The column number.
possibleNum - The value to be checked.
sudoku - The 2d sudoku used for checking.
Returns:
True if the poss number can be filled in, return false otherwise.

sudVol

public boolean sudVol()
Returns whether the sudoku is completely filled. This method checks for every cell, whether it contains a zero, if so return false, otherwise return true

Returns:
Return false if a zero is found, otherwise return true

percentageSolved2d

public int percentageSolved2d(int[][] sudoku)
Returns the percentage solved as an int. Determines for what percentage the sudoku is filled in. And returns it as an integer.

Parameters:
sudoku - The sudoku to be checked.
Returns:
The percentage as an Integer.

tactics

public int[][] tactics(int[][] sudoku)
Returns the updated sudoku. This method calls for the tactics to be performed on the sudoku. This is done by transforming the 2d sudoku back to the 3d one, so that the tactics can be performed, after which, it needs to be converted back to a 2d sudoku.

Parameters:
sudoku - The 2d sudoku to be updated.
Returns:
The updated 2d sudoku.

sudVol

public boolean sudVol(int[][] sudoku)
Returns whether the sudoku is completely filled. This method checks for every cell, whether it contains a zero, if so return false, otherwise return true

Parameters:
sudoku - The 2d sudoku, which needs to be checked.
Returns:
Return false if a zero is found, otherwise return true

bestCell

public int[] bestCell(int[][] sudoku)
Returns the best cell to try to fill using backtracking. This method determines the best cell to fill, by taking the cell with the least amount of possibilities for that cell

Parameters:
sudoku - The sudoku of which the best cell needs to be found
Returns:
The row and column index of the best cell.

solveBackTrack

public boolean solveBackTrack(int i,
                              int j,
                              int[][] sudoku)
Returns true if the sudoku is solved. This method uses backtracking to solve the sudoku." As long as the sudoku isn't solved it calls itself again.

Returns:
Return true if the sudoku is solved, otherwise return false.

toString2

public java.lang.String toString2()
Returns string ready for printing. This method creates a string of the sudoku, and places zeros at cells of which the value is unknown.

Returns:
The 2d sudoku ready for printing.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Returns String ready for printing. Creates a string of the 2d sudoku, which can be printed, with some extra lines for better readability.

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
The 2d sudoku, which can be printed.

countAmountNotZero

public int countAmountNotZero(int[] array)
Return amount non-zero entries cell. Count how many nonzero-values a single cell has i.e. how many possibilities has this cell at this moment

Parameters:
array - The cell of which the nonzero entries need to be counted
Returns:
The amount of nonzero entries.

public boolean checkAllOne(int[] array)
Checks if array contains only ones. This method checks if a 1x9 array has all ones.

Parameters:
array - The array to be checked.
Returns:
Returns true if array contains only ones returns false otherwise.

Returns:
Returns true, if no doubles are found, false otherwise.

checkNotConflicting

public boolean checkNotConflicting(int[][] sudoku)
Returns whether there are no conflicting values. This method checks for each row, column and quadrant, whether there are no multiple occurences of the same value.

Parameters:
sudoku - The 2d sudoku.
Returns:
Returns true, if no conflicting values are found, false otherwise.

Parameters:

i - The row number.
Returns:

                                  int q)

Parameters:
sudoku - The 2d sudoku.
q - The quadrant number.
Returns:
Returns true, if no doubles are found, false otherwise.

q2c

public int[] q2c(int q)
Converts quadrant to coordinate. Returns a coord as a 2x1 array, this array is the the coordinate of the upper left corner of quadrant q.

Parameters:
q - The quadrant number.
Returns:
A 2x1 array of the coordinates of the upperleft corner.
